alert.note: Alert for Eastern Las Animas County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:31PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Developing and scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Otero, eastern Las Animas and western Bent Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 126 PM MDT, scattered thunderstorms continue developing from eastern Las Animas County north-northeastward into Bent and Otero Counties. Movement of this band of activity is only slowly eastward at around 10 to 15 mph, but individual storms within the band are north-northeastward 30 to 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar and satellite indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations potentially impacted include... La Junta, North La Junta, Rocky Ford, Las Animas, Swink, Cheraw, Branson, Higbee, Hasty, Timpas, John Martin Reservoir and Fort Lyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong winds could extend well away from precipitation and lightning cores.
